title: Chicago March of Justice for George Floyd
location: Union Park, 1501 W Randolph St, Chicago, IL 60606
notes: This event is being planned by Activate: Chicagohttps://bit.ly/ActivateChiWe will march to end Police BrutalityWe will march because #blacklivesmatterWe march for justice for George Floyd and his FamilyThis march will be peacefulUnion Park is where we will meetwe start the protest here as a sit down protestfists in the airchanting love conquers allblack lives matterwe want justice we want peacelet freedom ringhere we will kick off our protest with those who would like to read poems or motivational speechesstay unitedstay peacefulstay safePlease wear your maskI’ve looked into this and where we are gathering for the march is completely legal and in a spot where you do not need a permit to protest ! please remember these are peaceful demonstrationssigns and mantras will doif you intend on destroying public property please know that is illegal and you will face the consequences per city of Chicagoif you plan on rioting do NOT attend this event it should be 100% PEACEFUL!!!!! AS THAT IS MY INTENTNO LITTERING bring garbage bagsi want us all to be as safe and educated as possible! and keep our city clean and intact as we show our solidarity

title: Walk To Recognize Racism
notes: Dear Community Leaders and Friends,Thank you all for joining a WALK TO RECOGNIZE RACISM, a peaceful march for our NW Chicago and Neighboring communities. Our journey begins at 10am, Saturday morning at Edgebrook Elementary School and will end at Wildwood Elementary School. At our arrival there will be a moment of reflection and music.This is a chance for us to begin the process and do the work. All families are welcome. Our goal is to end the divide and stand as a community.All of our neighboring communities are welcome to peacefully stand up against racism, please extend our heartfelt invitation.

title: United Against Racism & Police Violence/ Unidos contra el racismo y violencia policial
location: Two Feeder Caravans/Marches, starting at: Kelly HS (2725 W 41st St) and Harper HS (6520 S Wood St)
notes: During these times, we must demonstrate a united front against racism and police violence. Join community members from the Southside of Chicago in a March and Caravan towards #PoliceFreeSchools.Únase a miembros de la comunidad el sur de Chicago en marcha y caravana para #EscuelasLibresDePolicias.Gather at 10:30 a.m., Program at 11:00 a.m., Caravan/March FollowsDemands:-Cancel CPD contract with CPS-Fund restorative practices in all schools-Additional social workers and student support personnel in our schools-Civilian Police Accountability Council for Chicago-Support the Right to Recovery legislative package-Make all schools Sustainable Community Schools*****Two feeder caravan/march staging points:Kelly HS, 4136 S. California Ave. (cars can gather/park in lot)Harper HS, 6520 S. Wood*****We are asking that everyone wear masks and continue to practice social distancing.

title: Humboldt Park Unity For BLM
notes: It’s time we take a stand as people we will not tolerate anti blackness in our neighborhoods. We know there are more of you out there. Please don’t feel afraid to come out and support. We need to be more visible and vocal then a few wanting to divide black and brown people. Saturday at 6pm in Humboldt Park. If you can’t come please continue to have conversations about anti blackness with your family. Sometimes it’s just hard to find the words pero Si Se Puede. Your presence is valuable, be the change. See you on the frontlines. Come one… come all ✊🏽🙏🏽🖤 🤎 #BLM #BrownPeopleForBlackPower*Please wear a mask* We will have disposable ones if you need one. Thanks

title: Youth led Black & Brown Unity March: Justice for George Floyd
notes: 🚨ENGLISH:As students from the south side of Chicago, we will not accept any type of racial division in our city. We understand that when the Black community is under attack, we must stand up & fight back hand in hand. The brown community stands with the Black community as they fight for #GeorgeFloyd, #BreonnaTaylor & the countless many lives taken by police offers across the United States of America.We are currently facing two viruses in this country: #COVID19 and racism. We will make sure to make everyone’s health & safety a priority by reminding folks to wear a mask & social distance as much as possible.***This will be a peaceful action & we ask that folks come in peace. We do NOT condone any type of property damage done to our local community businesses.————————————————————————🚨Español:Como estudiantes del sur de Chicago, no aceptáremos ningún tipo de división racial en nuestra ciudad. Entendemos que cuando la comunidad negra está bajo ataque, debemos ponernos de pie y luchar de la mano. La comunidad hispana respalda a la comunidad negra mientras luchan por #GeorgeFloyd, #BreonnaTaylor y las innumerables vidas que la policía se ha llevado a través de los Estados Unidos de América.Actualmente nos enfrentamos a dos virus en este país: #COVID19 y el racismo. Nos aseguraremos de que la salud y la seguridad de todos sean una prioridad al recordarles a las personas que usen una máscara y distancia social tanto como sea posible.***Esta será una acción pacífica y pedimos que la gente venga en paz. NO aprobamos de ningún tipo de daño a nuestros negocios comunitarios locales.

title: Lincoln Square is Standing with Black Lives Matter-Safe Protest
location: Lincoln Ave and Sunnyside, Lincoln Square, Chicago, IL
notes: Have you wanted to be part of the upwelling of righteous protest against police brutality and senseless racist killing that has been happening across the city and the country, but didn’t want to risk your health or safety? This is your chance to do that: a quiet, socially-distanced display of our concern and anguish and our demand for change, happening here in our own neighborhood.We…1)Stand in solidarity with Black Lives Matters2)Demand justice for George Floyd, Breanna Taylor, and Ahmaud Arbery & all other victims.3)Demand a stop to police attacks on protesters4)Immediate accountability for the officers involved in the attack on two Black women in the Brickyard Mall on May 31st.Starting at the SW corner of Lincoln Ave and Sunnyside (across the street from Gideon Welles), protesters will social distance 6 – 10’ apart with the goal to ring Welles Park facing the street with our signs (preferably with messages on both sides). We don’t plan on chanting as that raises the risk for spreading Covid. A silent protest is powerful. We do not plan to march.For those who are higher risk for Covid or are concerned about being around too many people, we encourage a car caravan around the park as well.All participants must wear masks and social distance. This is a peaceful action. We would love for families to attend and show their support. We do not support any violence or property destruction!

title: Press Conference and Front-line Worker Speak Out
location: Dirksen Federal Building, 219 S Dearborn St, Chicago, Illinois 60604
notes: We will be holding a (socially distanced) press conference and public speak-out at the Dirksen Federal Building, noon on Monday, June 8, 2020.Workers will be announcing legal charges against the Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) for breaking worker’s First Amendment rights to freedom of speech. CTA management illegally broke up workers meetings discussing the safety and ethics of driving “police shuttles” which are being used to transport police and National Guard to demonstrations opposing the racist police murder of George Floyd.Please join us to defend workers’ rights to freedom of speech and right to oppose police murder. Front-line workers, such as nurses, grocery, big box, postal and delivery workers are especially welcome to speak out with us.

title: Black Lives Matter
notes: Comrades, we are not organizers, we started this page to amplify and promote existing protests organized by progressive leaders. Things are moving fast right now, and we have had submissions from individuals that could not be verified. We will continue to post protests that are publicly available.

title: All Protest Publishing Suspended Until Further Notice
notes: NOTE: We are making exceptions due to exceptional circumstances. Please protect yourself and the community from COVID 19 exposure.
